Content: *p65809a0316*turn over    3answer all questions.write your answers in the spaces provided.1 some plant extracts have been shown to have antimicrobial properties.(a) describe a method that can be used to study the antimicrobial properties of a plantextract.(5)

*p65809a0416*4(b) the antimicrobial properties of extracts from four species of plant (a, b, c and d) were investigated using three types of bacteria.the antimicrobial effect was scored on a scale of 0 to 3, where 0 is no effect and 3is a very large effect.the table shows the results of this investigation.type of bacteriascore for each species of plantabcdb. subtilis1302p. vulgaris0201s. aureus2323the results were plotted as a bar chart.key(i) complete the bar chart by labelling the axes and key, using the information in thetable.(3)
*p65809a0516*turn over    5(ii) evaluate the antimicrobial effects of these extracts.use the data to support your answer.(4)(total for question 1 = 12 marks)

*p65809a0616*62 flowering plants produce seeds that can be stored in a seed bank. this is done to conserve the biodiversity of plants.(a) (i) describe how seeds are treated and then stored in a seed bank.(3)(ii) state what is meant by the term biodiversity.(2)

*p65809a0716*turn over    7(b) the longer seeds are stored in seed banks, the less likely they are to germinate. this is due toageing.ageing of seeds can affect the growth of roots when the seeds germinate.determining the mitotic index of roots is one way to study growth of roots.(i) describe how the mitotic index of roots can be determined.(4)

*p65809a0816*8(ii) seeds can be treated to artificially age them.in an investigation, untreated and treated samples of seeds were germinated and the roots allowed to grow.roots of different lengths from the untreated seeds, seeds treated for 4days and seeds treated for 14days were selected.the mitotic index of these roots was determined.the graph shows the results of this investigation.0.02.04.06.08.010.0 12.09.08.07.06.05.04.03.02.01.00.0mitotic index (%)root length / mmuntreatedtreated for 4 daystreated for 14 daysthere were 14 cells undergoing mitosis in 8mm roots from seeds treated for 4days.calculate the total number of cells that were counted when the mitotic index wasdetermined.(3)total cells counted
*p65809a0916*turn over    9(iii)draw a table to show the data on the effect of root length on mitotic index in seeds treated for14days.(3)

*p65809a01016*10(iv)identify the conclusions that can be drawn from these data.(3)(v) the graph does not show the standard deviations of the means for mitoticindex.describe how the investigation could be modified to allow standard deviations to be obtained.(2)(total for question 2 = 20 marks)

*p65809a01416*14(d) in another study, the effect of boric acid concentration on pollen tube growth wasinvestigated.the graph shows the results of this study.0.00.51.01.52.02.53.53.04.0400350300250200150100500pollen tube growth (m)time / hoursboric acid concentration100mgdm30mgdm3200mgdm3300mgdm3(i) during the first two hours, the rate of pollen tube growth at a boricacid concentration of 100mgdm3 is 130.5m hour1.calculate the percentage increase in the rate of pollen tube growth between the rate at 0mgdm3 and the rate at 100mgdm3, during the firsttwohours.(2)%
